title.narrative: To strengthen Provision of Health Services to IDPs and Host Communities in 9 districts in Cabo Delgado Province

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to strengthen disease surveillance and enhance the early warning reporting system for early detection of notifiable diseases (cholera, malaria, Acute watery diarrhea, and measles) and the ongoing COVID19 Pandemic a life-saving strategy. The project will also strengthen the capacity of 100 health workers, including laboratory technicians, by training them in case management & testing using rapid Diagnostic kits (AgRDT) to test COVID19 cholera & AWD. Through the CERF grant for Underfunded Emergencies, WHO’s project will improve response capacity at the province and district level in the identified districts by training other 70 health workers identified from the hospitals and health centers on contact tracing and disease surveillance.Through the project, WHO will procure 200 Rapid Test kits( Immuno-chromatographic for detection of V. cholera in stool RDT CHOLERA (Crystal VC - Dipstick), Ag, stool, test, kit-10). The one-year project will benefit an estimated 74,167 people, among them 7,417 people living with disabilities, over 27,000 women and more than 6,600 girls.

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: Improved capacity for health workers and lab technicians
H.6 Proportion of functional health facilities sharing timely reports
Improved early disease detection and timely responding to disease outbreaks in the targeted districts
H.3 Number of people benefitting from cholera kits
